If successful, you will arrive as an invader (Bloody Finger) with the objective of defeating the Host of Fingers of that world. Glistening blood has been siphoned into the nail of this finger. Its sickly pale skin feels nothing now, but the nail still aches with sweetest pain.
000000AEWhite Cipher RingWhen invaded, requests the aid of a hunter Item for online play. (Can also be used from the Multiplayer menu.) Allows you to automatically request for a hunter from another world to come to your rescue when your world is invaded. (Summoning is not always possible.) One of the lost mystic codes said to have been bestowed by the Two Fingers.
000000AFBlue Cipher RingAnswers requests for summoning from hunters Item for online play. (Can also be used from the Multiplayer menu.) Puts the wearer in ready state to answer should someone in another world call for rescue. You will be summoned to their world as a hunter. During hunter multiplayer, your objective will be to defeat the invader of the summoned world.
000000B2Taunter's TongueLures in invaders Item for online play. (Can also be used from the Multiplayer menu.) Lures in invaders. This allows your world to be invaded without any Furled Finger cooperators present, and it also shortens the interval between windows of opportunity for invasion. Additionally, enables the arrival of a second invader to join when a cooperator is present. (With two invaders, the maximum number of cooperators becomes one.)
000000B3Small Golden EffigySends a co-op summoning sign to summoning pools Item for online play. (Can also be used from the Multiplayer menu.) Send a cooperative summon sign to several nearby summoning pools (activated pools only). In cooperative multiplayer, your objective will be to defeat the area boss of the world to which you were summoned.
000000B4Small Red EffigySends a hostile summoning sign to summoning pools Item for online play. (Can also be used from the Multiplayer menu.) Send a competitive summon sign to several nearby summoning pools (activated pools only). In competitive multiplayer, your objective will be to defeat the Host of Fingers of the world to which you were summoned.
000000B5Spectral Steed WhistleSummon and ride Torrent, the spectral steed A delicate goldwork ring. Can be used as a finger whistle. Sound the whistle to summon and ride Torrent, the spectral steed. (Dismounts steed when used while on horseback.) Upon his death, the spectral steed can be summoned again, but doing so drains the Flask of Crimson Tears.
000000B6Furlcalling Finger RemedyReveals co-op and hostile summoning signs Item for online play. (Can also be used from the Multiplayer menu.) Craftable item. Reveals cooperative and competitive multiplayer signs. Co-op summoning signs will be shown in gold, while hostile summoning signs will be shown in red. Multiplayer begins when you summon a player from another world through their sign.
000000B7Festering Bloody FingerAttempts invasion of other player's world Item for online play. (Can also be used from the Multiplayer menu.) Consumed upon use. Attempts an invasion of another player's world. If successful, you will arrive as an invader (Bloody Finger) with the objective of defeating the Host of Fingers of that world. This furled finger is blackened with blood congestion. It seems to have been chopped off rather unceremoniously.
000000B8Recusant FingerAttempts invasion of other player's world Item for online play. (Can also be used from the Multiplayer menu.) Attempts an invasion of another player's world. If successful, you will arrive as an invader (Recusant) with the objective of defeating the Host of Fingers of that world. This furled finger is covered in snake scales. An heirloom of the lord of the Volcano Manor, bequeathed to Tarnished who have become family.
000000BERune ArcGrants the blessing of an equipped Great Rune upon use A shard of the shattered Elden Ring. Grants the blessing of an equipped Great Rune upon use. Even if no Great Rune is equipped, it will slightly increase maximum HP upon use. The lower arc of the Elden Ring is held to be the basin in which its blessings pool. Perhaps this shard originates from that very arc.
000000BFGodrick's Great RuneRaises all attributes A Great Rune of the shardbearer Godrick. Its blessing raises all attributes. This Great Rune is known as the anchor ring, found in the center of the Elden Ring. The first demigods were The Elden Lord Godfrey and his offspring, the golden lineage.
000000C0Radahn's Great RuneRaises maximum HP, FP and stamina A Great Rune of the shardbearer Radahn. Its blessing raises maximum HP, FP and Stamina. Radahn was amongst the children of Rennala and Radagon, who became demigod stepchildren after Radagon's union with Queen Marika. The Great Rune burns, to resist the encroachment of the scarlet rot.
000000C1Morgott's Great RuneGreatly raises maximum HP A Great Rune of the shardbearer Morgott. Its blessing greatly raises maximum HP. This Great Rune is the anchor ring that houses the base, and proves two things: That the Omen King was born of the golden lineage, and that he was indeed the Lord of Leyndell.
000000C2Rykard's Great RuneRestores HP upon defeating enemies A Great Rune of the shardbearer Rykard. Its blessing restores HP upon defeating enemies. Rykard was amongst the children of Rennala and Radagon, who became demigod stepchildren after Radagon's union with Queen Marika. But Rykard fed himself to the blasphemous serpent, Great Rune and all.
000000C3Mohg's Great RuneGrants a blessing of blood to phantoms A Great Rune of the shardbearer Mohg. Its blessing grants a blessing of blood to summoned phantoms, and imparts a Phantom Great Rune upon successful invasion. Mohg and Morgott are twin brothers, and their Great Runes are naturally similar. But Mohg's rune is soaked in accursed blood, from his devout love for the wretched mire that he was born into far below the earth.
000000C4Malenia's Great RuneAttacks recover HP after damage is taken A Great Rune of the shardbearer Malenia. The blessing of this half-rotted rune reduces the healing power of Flask of Crimson Tears. And yet, due to the infusion of Malenia's spirit of resistance, attacks made immediately after receiving damage will partially recover HP. Malenia is daughter to Queen Marika and Radagon, and her Great Rune should have been the most sacred of all.
000000C8Flask of Crimson TearsRestores HP, but is currently empty A sacred flask modelled after a golden holy chalice that was once graced by a tear of life. Filled with crimson tears, this flask restores HP with use. Though currently empty, simply rest at a site of grace to replenish. It is said that a Finger Maiden will bestow two such chalices upon the chosen Tarnished when they meet.
000000C9Flask of Crimson TearsRestores HP A sacred flask modelled after a golden holy chalice that was once graced by a tear of life. Filled with crimson tears, this flask restores HP with use. Rest at a site of grace to replenish. It is said that a Finger Maiden will bestow two such chalices upon the chosen Tarnished when they meet.
000000CAFlask of Crimson Tears +1Restores HP, but is currently empty A sacred flask modelled after a golden holy chalice that was once graced by a tear of life. Filled with crimson tears, this flask restores HP with use. Though currently empty, simply rest at a site of grace to replenish. It is said that a Finger Maiden will bestow two such chalices upon the chosen Tarnished when they meet.
000000CBFlask of Crimson Tears +1Restores HP A sacred flask modelled after a golden holy chalice that was once graced by a tear of life. Filled with crimson tears, this flask restores HP with use. Rest at a site of grace to replenish. It is said that a Finger Maiden will bestow two such chalices upon the chosen Tarnished when they meet.
000000CCFlask of Crimson Tears +2Restores HP, but is currently empty A sacred flask modelled after a golden holy chalice that was once graced by a tear of life. Filled with crimson tears, this flask restores HP with use. Though currently empty, simply rest at a site of grace to replenish. It is said that a Finger Maiden will bestow two such chalices upon the chosen Tarnished when they meet.
000000CDFlask of Crimson Tears +2Restores HP A sacred flask modelled after a golden holy chalice that was once graced by a tear of life. Filled with crimson tears, this flask restores HP with use. Rest at a site of grace to replenish. It is said that a Finger Maiden will bestow two such chalices upon the chosen Tarnished when they meet.
000000CEFlask of Crimson Tears +3Restores HP, but is currently empty A sacred flask modelled after a golden holy chalice that was once graced by a tear of life. Filled with crimson tears, this flask restores HP with use. Though currently empty, simply rest at a site of grace to replenish. It is said that a Finger Maiden will bestow two such chalices upon the chosen Tarnished when they meet.
000000CFFlask of Crimson Tears +3Restores HP A sacred flask modelled after a golden holy chalice that was once graced by a tear of life. Filled with crimson tears, this flask restores HP with use. Rest at a site of grace to replenish. It is said that a Finger Maiden will bestow two such chalices upon the chosen Tarnished when they meet.

000000FAFlask of Wondrous PhysickBestows various special effects A relic of the physick chemists, priests of the Erdtree. Harnesses the powers of crystal tears, which only form after the passage of many moons. Various special effects are bestowed upon the drinker, dependent on the specific mixture of crystal tears. Rest at a site of grace to replenish. Basins are placed at the feet of Minor Erdtrees throughout the Lands Between in order to collect their crystallized tears.
000000FBFlask of Wondrous PhysickBestows various special effects, but is empty now A relic of the physick chemists, priests of the Erdtree. Harnesses the powers of crystal tears, which only form after the passage of many moons. Various special effects are bestowed upon the drinker, dependent on the specific mixture of crystal tears. Though currently empty, simply rest at a site of grace to replenish. Basins are placed at the feet of Minor Erdtrees throughout the Lands Between in order to collect their crystallized tears.
0000012CFire PotThrow at enemies to inflict fire damage A cocktail of incendiary materials sealed inside a pot. Throw at enemies to inflict fire damage.
0000012DRedmane Fire PotThrow at enemies to inflict heavy fire damage Craftable item prepared using a ritual pot. Engraved with the crest of red-maned lion. Throw at enemies to inflict heavy fire damage. Even today, the survivors of Radahn's battalion employ fire to stave off the scarlet rot.
0000012EGiantsflame Fire PotUses FP. Throw at enemies to inflict heavy fire damage. Craftable item prepared using a ritual pot. Enchanted by incantations of the Giants' Flame. Consumes FP. Throw at enemies to inflict heavy fire damage. Damage scales with faith.
00000140Lightning PotThrow at enemies to inflict lightning damage A cocktail of fulminating materials sealed inside a pot. Throw at enemies to inflict lightning damage.
00000141Ancient Dragonbolt PotThrow at enemies to inflict heavy lightning damage Craftable item prepared using a ritual pot. Engraved with the crest of the ancient dragon. Throw at enemies to inflict heavy lightning damage. Allows one to wield ancient drake lightning regardless of faith. The residual power of relics is a purely natural phenomenon.
0000014AFetid PotThrow at enemies to cause buildup of deadly poison A cocktail of effluents sealed inside a pot. As the mixture ferments, toxins are produced alongside a putrid stench that seeps out once ripe. Throw at enemies to cause buildup of deadly poison. Beware though; those who carry these pots will slowly accumulate poison in their own bodies. Push someone in a privy; expect to get dung on your hands.
00000154Swarm PotThrow to release a swarm of bloodflies A cocktail of effluents sealed inside a pot. Throw at enemies to set a swarm of bloodflies upon them. The vile swarm deals damage and builds up onset of blood loss. The cacophony of their wings assails the sanity of berserkers. The maggots found in waste feed on blood and turn into vicious flies that are pitiably short-lived.
0000015EHoly Water PotThrow at enemies to inflict holy damage Enchanted by incantations of the Golden Order. Throw at enemies to inflict holy damage. Highly effective against Those Who Live in Death, even preventing them from rising again. The Golden Order has no mercy for those who trespass beyond life's bounds.
0000015FSacred Order PotUses FP. Throw at enemies to inflict heavy holy damage. Craftable item prepared using a ritual pot. Enchanted by incantations of the Golden Order. Consumes FP. Throw at enemies to inflict heavy holy damage. Highly effective against Those Who Live in Death, even preventing them from rising again. The Golden Order has no mercy for those who trespass beyond life's bounds.
00000168Freezing PotThrow at enemies to cause buildup of frost A pot engraved with the crest of the Carian Royals. Throw at enemies to cause buildup of frost. Originates from the cold, dark moon of Ranni, the Carian princess.
00000172Poison PotThrow at enemies to cause buildup of poison A cocktail of poisonous materials sealed inside a pot. Throw at enemies to cause buildup of poison.
0000017COil PotThrow at enemies to soak them in oil Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot. A cocktail of oil-infused materials is sealed inside. Throw at enemies to soak them in oil, making them heavily susceptible to fire damage.
00000186Alluring PotThrow at enemies to lure human-build foes Pot enchanted with assassin incantations. Throw at enemies to create a pale shadow. The illusion will lure in and distract foes of human frame.
00000187Beastlure PotThrow at enemies to lure beastly prey Pot enchanted with assassin incantations. Throw at enemies to create a red shadow. The illusion lures in beasts into attacking it.
00000190Roped Fire PotThrow behind to inflict fire damage Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot. A cocktail of incendiary materials is sealed inside, and a short rope that aids throwing has been secured around the pot. Throw at rearward enemies to inflict fire damage.
000001A4Roped Lightning PotThrow behind to inflict lightning damage Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot. A cocktail of fulminating materials is sealed inside, and a short rope that aids throwing has been secured around the pot. Throw at rearward enemies to inflict lightning damage.
000001AERoped Fetid PotThrow behind to cause buildup of deadly poison Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot. A cocktail of effluents is sealed inside, and a short rope that aids throwing has been secured around the pot. Throw at rearward enemies to cause buildup of deadly poison. Beware though; those who carry these pots will slowly accumulate poison in their own bodies. Push someone in a privy; expect to get dung on your hands.
000001B8Roped Poison PotThrow behind to cause buildup of poison Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot. A cocktail of poisonous materials is sealed inside, and a short rope that aids throwing has been secured around the pot. Throw at rearward enemies to cause buildup of poison.
000001C2Roped Oil PotThrow behind to douse enemies in oil Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot. A cocktail of oil-infused materials is sealed inside, and a short rope that aids throwing has been secured around the pot. Throw at rearward enemies to soak them in oil, making them heavily susceptible to fire damage.
000001CCRoped Magic PotUses FP. Throw behind to inflict magic damage. Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot. A cocktail of magically resonant materials is sealed inside, and a short rope that aids throwing has been secured around the pot. Consumes FP. Throw at rearward enemies to inflict magic damage.
000001D6Roped Fly PotThrow behind to release a swarm of flies Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot. A cocktail of effluents is sealed inside, and a short rope that aids throwing has been secured around the pot. Throw at rearward enemies to release a swarm of flies. Their fangs inflict countless painful lacerations on the victim while the grating sound of their wings assails their sanity. The maggots found in waste feed on blood and turn into vicious flies that are pitiably short-lived.
000001E0Roped Freezing PotThrow behind to cause frostbite build-up Craftable with a cracked pot. Frost has been sealed inside. A short rope that aids throwing is attached. Thrown at rearward enemies using the rope, the pot explodes, causing frostbite buildup in enemies.
000001EARoped Volcano PotCreates heat cloud, causing continuous fire damage Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot. Powdered volcanic rock is sealed inside, and a short rope that aids throwing has been secured around the pot. Thrown at rearward enemies to disperse a cloud of heat, dealing continuous damage to those caught inside for a short duration.
000001FERoped Holy Water PotUses FP. Throw behind to inflict holy damage. Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot. Enchanted by incantations of the Golden Order, and a short rope that aids throwing has been secured around the pot. Consumes FP. Throw at rearward enemies to inflict holy damage. Highly effective against Those Who Live in Death, even preventing them from rising again. The Golden Order has no mercy for those who trespass beyond life's bounds.
00000258Volcano PotCreates heat cloud, causing continuous fire damage Powdered volcanic rock sealed inside a pot. Throw at enemies to disperse a cloud of heat, dealing continuous damage to those caught inside for a short duration.
00000262Albinauric PotUses FP. Throw to impede healing using a flask of tears. Craftable item prepared using a ritual pot. Enchanted by sorceries of the Cuckoos. Consumes FP. Throw at enemies to impede recovery actions using a flask of tears for a certain duration. The Knights of the Cuckoos do declare. Behold, thy defiled blood. Unlike any humor that flows in our grand realm.
00000276Cursed-Blood PotThrow to douse enemy with accursed blood Craftable item prepared using a ritual pot. Decorated with the crest of the Lord of Blood. Throw at enemies to douse them in accursed blood, causing summoned spirits to assail them with a rabid fervor. A childhood memory of the Lord of Blood.
00000280Sleep PotThrow at enemies to cause buildup of sleep Pot enchanted by the incantations of St. Trina. Throw at enemies to cause buildup of sleep. Like a lullaby, or a quagmire, its light-purple haze irresistibly draws its victims down into sleep. Sweet dreams.
0000028ARancor PotThrow at enemies to spawn vengeful spirits Pot enchanted by the ancient death hex. Throw at enemies to spawn vengeful spirits that chase down foes. In times of old, the dead were burned with ghostflame, and from those cinders arose vengeful spirits.
00000294Magic PotThrow at enemies to inflict magic damage A cocktail of magically resonant materials sealed inside a pot. Called a "faux sorcery" in Raya Lucaria. Throw at enemies to inflict magic damage.
00000295Academy Magic PotUses FP. Throw to inflict heavy magic damage. Craftable item prepared using a ritual pot. Enchanted by Raya Lucaria sorceries. Consumes FP. Throw at enemies to inflict heavy magic damage. This pot, considered a "faux sorcery," was employed to protect the academy.
0000029ERot PotThrow at enemies to cause buildup of scarlet rot A pot decorated with the crest of scarlet wings. Throw at enemies to cause buildup of scarlet rot. The rot bubbles up from the Swamp of Aeonia, and eats away at life like a vicious plague.
000002BCWending GraceRise from defeat a single time An afterglow of lost grace unleashed by the tide of Night. Allows one to rise from defeat a single time. Will take effect when kept in possessions. Lost upon use. The world crumbles. And yet light, forgetful of its own path, still seeks a follower to bestow guidance upon, summoning again grace once lost.
0000032ARowa RaisinOn horseback, feed to Torrent to restore HP Preparation of dried Rowa fruit. Craftable item. Feed to Torrent, the spectral steed, while riding to restore his HP. Humans are unable to digest Rowa fruit, but Torrent seems to have a taste for it.
0000032BSweet RaisinOn horseback, feed to Torrent to greatly restore HP Preparation of dried Golden Rowa fruit. Craftable item. Feed to Torrent, the spectral steed, while riding to greatly restore his HP. Golden Rowa fruit is not unlike honey, and Torrent seems to have a taste for it.
0000032CFrozen RaisinOn horseback, feed to Torrent to vastly restore HP Preparation of dried Rimed Rowa. Craftable item. Feed to Torrent, the spectral steed, while riding to vastly restore his HP. Torrent seems to enjoy the sensation of chewing this frozen, dried seed.
00000334Boiled CrabGreatly boosts physical damage negation for a time Boiled crab meat. A prime specimen of plump and moist meat. True connoisseurs know how to keep from over-salting. Greatly boosts physical damage negation for a certain duration. Unlike the "prawn" sold, this truly is crab. Not that it matters, it's delicious all the same.
0000033EBoiled PrawnBoosts physical damage negation for a time Boiled prawn meat. A prime specimen of plump and moist meat. True connoisseurs know how to keep from over-salting. Boosts physical damage negation for a certain duration. The meat actually looks to have come from a crayfish. Not that it matters, it's delicious all the same.
00000384Neutralizing BolusesAlleviates poison buildup and cures poison Green boluses made from cave moss. Alleviates poison buildup and cures poison ailment. Also boosts resistance and gradually restores HP. Poison accumulates gradually, coming into effect once the threshold is reached. Poison ailment lowers HP in steady increments for a period.
0000038EStanching BolusesAlleviates impending blood loss Red boluses made from cave moss. Alleviates impending blood loss. Also boosts resistance and gradually restores HP. Blood loss escalates gradually, causing great damage once the threshold is reached. Take one of these in timely fashion to avoid such an event.
00000398Thawfrost BolusesAlleviates buildup of frost Ice-hued boluses made from cave moss. Alleviates buildup of frost and cures frostbite ailment. Also boosts resistance and gradually restores HP. Frost accumulates gradually, causing damage and inflicting frostbite once the threshold is reached. Vulnerability to damage increases for a certain duration.
000003A2Stimulating BolusesAlleviates buildup of sleep Light-purple boluses made from cave moss. Alleviates buildup of sleep. Also boosts resistance and gradually restores HP. Sleep accumulates gradually, causing sudden fogginess and loss of FP once the threshold is reached, even if it does not force the afflicted into true slumber. Take one of these in timely fashion to avoid such an event.
000003ACPreserving BolusesAlleviates scarlet rot buildup and cures rot Scarlet boluses made of cave moss. Alleviates scarlet rot buildup and cures rot aliment. Also boosts resistance and gradually restores HP. Scarlet rot accumulates gradually, coming into effect once the threshold is reached. Scarlet rot ailment greatly lowers HP in steady increments for a period.
000003B6Rejuvenating BolusesAlleviates death blight buildup Black boluses made of cave moss. Alleviates death blight buildup. Also boosts resistance and gradually restores HP. Blight accumulates slowly, causing instant death once the threshold is reached. Take one of these in timely fashion to avoid such an event.
000003C0Clarifying BolusesAlleviates madness buildup Yellow boluses made of cave moss. Alleviates madness buildup. Also boosts resistance and gradually restores HP. Madness accumulates slowly, inflicting heavy damage and reducing FP once the threshold is reached. Take one of these in timely fashion to avoid such an event.
000003E8Flask of Crimson TearsRestores HP, but is currently empty A sacred flask modelled after a golden holy chalice that was once graced by a tear of blessing. Filled with crimson tears, this flask restores HP with use. Though currently empty, simply rest at a site of grace to replenish. The one washed up on the gravesite was sure to die, until this flask offered its gift of rejuvenation. To seek the Elden Ring.

It will replenish itself after a period of time, but touching a Site of Grace will restore it immediately.

000003FCFlask of Crimson Tears +10Restores HP, but is currently empty A sacred flask modelled after a golden holy chalice that was once graced by a tear of blessing. Filled with crimson tears, this flask restores HP with use. Though currently empty, simply rest at a site of grace to replenish. The one washed up on the gravesite was sure to die, until this flask offered its gift of rejuvenation. To seek the Elden Ring.

0000044CPickled Turtle NeckTemporarily boosts stamina recovery Turtle neck meat, pickled in a bitter medicinal solution. Temporarily boosts stamina recovery. The nutrients churn through the body, practically boiling out endless power.
00000456Immunizing Cured MeatTemporarily boosts immunity Cured strip of meat, dried out after pickling in a green medicinal solution. Craftable item. Temporarily boosts immunity. Higher immunity helps to mitigate the buildup of various poisons and scarlet rot.
00000460Invigorating Cured MeatTemporarily boosts robustness Cured strip of meat, dried out after pickling in a red medicinal solution. Craftable item. Temporarily boosts robustness. Higher robustness helps to mitigate the buildup of frost and blood loss.
0000046AClarifying Cured MeatTemporarily boosts focus Cured strip of meat, dried out after pickling in a purple medicinal solution. Craftable item. Temporarily boosts focus. Higher focus helps to mitigate the buildup of sleep and madness.
00000474Dappled Cured MeatTemporarily boosts immunity, robustness and focus Cured strip of meat, dried out after pickling in a dappled medicinal solution. Craftable item. Temporarily boosts immunity, robustness, and focus.
0000047ESpellproof Dried LiverTemporarily boosts magic damage negation Cured animal liver, dried out after pickling in a blue medicinal solution. Craftable item. Temporarily boosts magic damage negation, improving damage mitigation against attacks imbued with magic.
00000488Fireproof Dried LiverTemporarily boosts fire damage negation Cured animal liver, dried out after pickling in a red medicinal solution. Craftable item. Temporarily boosts fire damage negation, improving damage mitigation against attacks imbued with fire.
00000492Lightningproof Dried LiverTemporarily boosts lightning damage negation Cured animal liver, dried out after pickling in an yellow medicinal solution. Craftable item. Temporarily boosts lightning damage negation, improving damage mitigation against attacks imbued with lightning.
0000049CHolyproof Dried LiverTemporarily boosts holy damage negation Cured animal liver, dried out after pickling in a golden medicinal solution. Craftable item. Temporarily boosts holy damage negation, improving damage mitigation against attacks imbued with holiness.
000004A6Silver-Pickled Fowl FootTemporarily boosts item discovery Four-toed foot of a fowl, pickled in a silvery medicinal solution. Temporarily boosts item discovery. Since old times, the needy would scrape the meat clean even from a fowl's claw.
000004B0Gold-Pickled Fowl FootBoosts rune acquisition for a time Four-toed foot of a fowl, pickled in a golden medicinal solution. Boosts the amount of runes obtained from defeating enemies for a certain duration. Since old times, the needy would scrape the meat clean even from a fowl's claw.
000004BAExalted FleshTemporarily boosts physical attack A lump of animal flesh pickled in a medicinal solution mixed with fiery spices. Temporarily boosts physical attack. Considered a delicacy in the badlands, this invigorating repast was for the exclusive benefit of those who they deem heroes.
000004C4Deathsbane JerkyBoost instant death resistance for a short time A grey colored cured liver, dried out after pickling in a medicinal solution. Craftable item. Boosts instant death resistance for a short time.
000004D3Raw Meat DumplingRestores HP but also poisons the user A pungent raw meatball, made succulent by virtue of being on the verge of turning. Restores HP but also poisons the user. Not recommended for those who prefer to know the origin of their meats.
000004D8Shabriri GrapeYellowing, oozing eyeball of the infirm A yellowing, oozing eyeball of the infirm. The surface is shriveled, and the inside is squishy, not unlike a large, overly-ripe grape. Give to the blind maiden to guide her to the distant light.
0000050AStarlight ShardsRestores FP An ephemeral sliver that gives off a pale blue glow. What remains of a passing flash of starlight. Restores FP. A prized item that was once used in the Eternal City as an ingredient in intoxicating draughts.
0000051EImmunizing White Cured MeatTemporarily boosts immunity A white sliced meat, dried out after pickling in a green medicinal solution. Craftable item. Temporarily boosts immunity. Lasts longer than traditional cured meat, but with reduced effectiveness.

Temporarily boosts immunity, robustness, and focus. Lasts longer than traditional cured meat, but with reduced effectiveness.

Boosts resistance to instant death for a short time. The blood has been properly drained, giving it a longer effect than traditional dried meat.

Quickly coats weapon, inflicting frostbite. The women of the Carian royal family look to the moon to guide their fates. Rani's is a moon dark and blanketed with rime.
00000636Drawstring Rot GreaseQuickly coats armament, inflicting scarlet rot Solidified grease made from a mixture of rotten materials. Craftable item. A short string is attached to this lump. Quickly coats armament, inflicting scarlet rot, but with a brief effect, owing to its small size.
0000069AShield GreaseBoosts guarding ability and all damage negation Solidified grease made from a mixture of magically resonant materials. Coats left-hand armament, boosting guarding ability and all forms of damage negation. The effect lasts only for a short time. Primarily used on shields.
000006A4Throwing DaggerThrow at enemies to inflict damage Short dagger for throwing. It has no handguard. The blade is polished, and its weight is expertly balanced. Throw at enemies to deal damage. This auxiliary weapon, used primarily to constrain an enemy's movements, can still be deadly in the right hands.
000006AEBone DartThrow at enemies to inflict damage Animal bone sharpened into a knife for throwing. Craftable item. Throw at enemies to inflict damage.
000006B8Poisonbone DartThrow at enemies to inflict damage and build up poison Animal bone sharpened into a knife for throwing, with a poison-laced tip. Throw at enemies to inflict damage and build up poison.
000006C2KukriThrow at enemies to inflict damage and build up onset of blood loss A large knife used for throwing. Its curved blade is sharp enough to slice flesh cleanly. Throw at enemies to inflict damage and build up onset of blood loss. This heavy throwing weapon is unsuitable for swift attacks, but is able to inflict heavy damage.
000006CCCrystal DartThrow at enemies to inflict magic damage Throwing knife chiseled from impure crystal. Throw at enemies to deal magic damage. Long ago, it is said that a golem crafter employed a similar crystal tool.
000006D6Fan DaggersThrow fanned-out knives at enemies to inflict damage A set of five throwing knives bundled together. A concealed weapon cherished by the raptor assassins. The thin knives fan out when thrown, dealing damage to the target. Each knife deals paltry damage, but the wide range makes it suitable for constraining enemies.
000006E0Ruin FragmentFound near the remains of fallen ruins Stone fragment found near places where ruins have fallen from the sky. Can be used for crafting, or simply for throwing at enemies. These shards of stone are believed to have once been part of a temple in the sky. They glow with a faint light from within.
00000712Fetid FleshUtterly entrances wild beasts A lump of beast flesh pickled in egg wash. Craftable item. Beasts are highly attracted to its scent. The rancid scent prevents ingestion by any ordinary human.
00000726Explosive StoneExplodes when thrown, inflicting fire damage A small stone with a smoldering core. Explodes when thrown at enemies, inflicting fire damage. Miners employ these stones as tools for rock blasting, but have long forgotten how to craft them.
00000727Explosive Stone ClumpExplodes when thrown together, inflicting fire damage A clump of small stones with smoldering cores. Explodes when thrown together at enemies, inflicting fire damage. Miners employ these stones as tools for rock blasting, but have long forgotten how to craft them.
00000730Poisoned StoneThrow at enemies to cause buildup of poison A small stone with a poison core. Throw at enemies to cause buildup of poison. Miners employ these stones as tools for pest extermination, but have long forgotten how to craft them.
00000731Poisoned Stone ClumpThrow together to cause buildup of poison A clump of small stones with poison cores. Throw together at enemies to cause buildup of poison. Miners employ these stones as tools for pest extermination, but have long forgotten how to craft them.
000007E4Rainbow StoneShines with colored light when placed, serving as a guide Ruin Fragment that has undergone some simple processing. Craftable item. Stones such as these shine with the colors of the rainbow, making them useful markers when placed on the ground. Can also be dropped to gauge the distance of a fall. The higher the pitch of the sound, the higher the likelihood of the fall being fatal. Once used to entertain children on the fringes of the Lands Between.
000007EEGlowstoneEmits a faint light from the location it is placed Polished Ruin Fragment that shines brighter than Rainbow Stone. Craftable item. Emits light from the location it is placed, illuminating surroundings. However, the effect is short-lived, and it lacks the diverse colors of rainbow stones. May serve some benefit in dark places, or at night.
000007F8TelescopeAllows viewer to see faraway things Astrology tool used by members of the Carian royal family. A stolen part of a larger instrument. Allows the viewer to better see faraway things. During the age of the Erdtree, Carian astrology withered on the vine. The fate once writ in the night skies had been fettered by the Golden Order.
00000802Grace MimicLight shows the path, but without order A fetish indicating the guidance of grace. Craftable item. Similar to grace, this fetish draws rays guiding the way, only without any sense of order. Useful as a last resort for those who have lost their way, or for use by those who believe that unrefined guidance will lead to truer encounters.
00000816LanternAttach to waist to illuminate surroundings A small waist-worn lantern that illuminates surroundings. Use once to turn on, and again to turn off. While its light is dimmer than that of a torch, it has the advantage of freeing up the user's hands.
00000820Blasphemous ClawDeflects the power of the Black Blade A slab of rock engraved with traces of the Rune of Death. Can deflect the power of the Black Blade. On the night of the dire plot, Ranni rewarded Praetor Rykard with these traces. Should the coming trespass one day transpire, they would serve as a last-resort foil, allowing Rykard to challenge Maliketh the Black Blade, the black beast of Destined Death.
0000082ADeathrootBeast Clergyman seeks and devours these A source that gives rise to Those Who Live in Death. The Beast Clergyman, found at Bestial Sanctum in the distant east, collects and devours these roots. On the night of the dire plot the stolen Rune of Death enabled the first Death of a demigod. Later, the Rune of Death spread across the Lands Between through the underground roots of the Greattree, sprouting in the form of Deathroot.
00000834Soft CottonTemporarily reduces fall damage/sound and sound of footsteps A soft but sturdy cotton formed from splitting open Rowa fruit in a particular manner. Craftable item. Attaching this cotton to the bottom of one's feet allows for a temporary reduction in fall damage and sound. It also reduces the sound of one's footsteps. If you must court danger, at the very least, tread lightly.
00000848SoapRemoves filth and accumulations on the body A plant-based soap made from mushroom juice. Craftable item. Cleans off filth and other accumulations on the body while also slightly reducing poison buildup. Filth covering the exterior eventually seeps inside, soiling one's very spirit.
00000852Celestial DewCarry out Absolution at the Church of Vows A hidden Tear found in the Eternal City. Also known as a Night Tear. Allows one to carry out an Absolution at the Church of Vows, reversing all antagonizations. Once upon a time, the stars of the night sky guided fate, and this is a recollection of those times.
0000085CMargit's ShackleBriefly binds Margit, once imprisoned, to earth A fetish bathed in golden magic. Shackles were used to bind the accursed people called the Omen, and these ones were made to keep a particular Omen under strictest confinement. Though faint, the shackles still retain vestiges of powerâ€”enough to trap the once-bound Margit on earth, if only for a short time.
00000866Mohg's ShackleBriefly binds Mohg, once imprisoned, to earth A fetish bathed in golden magic. Shackles were used to bind the accursed people called the Omen, and these ones were made to keep a particular Omen under strictest confinement. Though faint, the shackles still retain vestiges of powerâ€”enough to trap the once-bound Mohg on earth, if only for a short time.
00000870Pureblood Knight's MedalAudience with Mohg will be granted, one day Proof that one is a glorious knight of the new Dynasty of Mohgwyn that the Lord of Blood will inaugurate. Use to be granted audience with Mohg. Only, it is not yet time. For Mohg yet slumbers beside the Divinity. Be patient. The new dynasty is nigh.
0000088EMiquella's NeedleSubdues a once-accepted frenzied flame One of the unalloyed gold needles that Miquella crafted to ward away the meddling of outer gods. Capable of subduing the flame of frenzy if inherited, allowing one to cheat fate and avoid becoming Lord of Frenzied Flame. However, the needle is as yet unfinished and can only be used in the heart of the storm beyond time said to be found in Faram Azula.
00000898Prattling Pate "Hello"Emits a voice that says "Hello" Twisted clay sculpt in the shape of a human head. Emits a voice that says "Hello." A wistful fetish that imparts voices and words on an eternal journey.
00000899Prattling Pate "Thank you"Emits a voice that says "Thank you" Twisted clay sculpt in the shape of a human head. Emits a voice that says "Thank you." A wistful fetish that imparts voices and words on an eternal journey.

0000089FPrattling Pate "You're beautiful"Emits a voice that says "You're beautiful" Twisted clay sculpt in the shape of a demi-human head. Emits a voice that says "You're beautiful." A wistful fetish that imparts voices and words on an eternal journey. Unconditional love. Unrestrained assurance. It must have been a mother speaking. Grace was brought to the very fringes and lowlands of the Lands Between. And with the Golden Order came the weight of its history. A history of conquest and subjugation.

00000B67Lord's RuneUse to gain an enormous abundance of runes Grace that dwells within the inhabitants of the Lands Between; true vestiges of gold. Use to gain 50000 runes. Runes of one who was destined to become a Lord, but when the Elden Ring was shattered, all that remained was a distant duty.
00000B86Remembrance of the GraftedTake the power of its namesake via Finger Reader Remembrance of Godrick, the Grafted, hewn into the Erdtree. The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader. Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes. A feeble man sought power through the grotesque act of grafting. "One day we'll return together, to our home, bathed in rays of gold."
00000B87Remembrance of the StarscourgeTake the power of its namesake via Finger Reader Remembrance of Starscourge Radahn, hewn into the Erdtree. The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader. Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes. The Red Lion General wielded gravitational powers which he learned in Sellia during his younger days. All so he would never have to abandon his beloved but scrawny steed.
00000B88Remembrance of the Omen KingTake the power of its namesake via Finger Reader Remembrance of Morgott, the Omen King, hewn into the Erdtree. The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader. Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes. Though born one of the graceless Omen, Morgott took it upon himself to become the Erdtree's protector. He loved not in return, for he was never loved, but nevertheless, love it he did.
00000B89Remembrance of the BlasphemousTake the power of its namesake via Finger Reader Remembrance of Rykard, Lord of Blasphemy, hewn into the Erdtree. The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader. Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes. Rykard took the form of a giant serpent that he might devour, grow, and live eternally. "I understand. The road of blasphemy is long and perilous. One cannot walk it unprepared to sin."
00000B8ARemembrance of the Rot GoddessTake the power of its namesake via Finger Reader Remembrance of Malenia, Goddess of Rot, hewn into the Erdtree. The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader. Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes. Miquella and Malenia are both the children of a single god. As such they are both Empyreans, but suffered afflictions from birth. One was cursed with eternal childhood, and the other harbored rot within.
00000B8BRemembrance of the Blood LordTake the power of its namesake via Finger Reader Remembrance of Mohg, Lord of Blood, hewn into the Erdtree. The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader. Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes. Wishing to raise Miquella to full godhood, Mohg wished to become his consort, taking the role of monarch. But no matter how much of his bloody bedchamber he tried to share, he received no response from the young Empyrean.
00000B8CRemembrance of the Black BladeTake the power of its namesake via Finger Reader Remembrance of Maliketh, the Black Blade, hewn into the Erdtree. The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader. Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes. Maliketh was a shadowbound beast given to his Empyrean. Marika's sole need of her shadow was a vessel to lock away Destined Death. Even then, she betrayed him.
00000B8DRemembrance of Hoarah LouxTake the power of its namesake via Finger Reader Remembrance of the warrior Hoarah Loux, hewn into the Erdtree. The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader. Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes. When Godfrey, first Elden Lord was robbed of his grace, becoming Tarnished, he took with him his kinfolk and left the Lands Between. After the Long March of the Tarnished came to an end, Godfrey divested himself of kingship, becoming a simple warrior once more.
00000B8ERemembrance of the DragonlordTake the power of its namesake via Finger Reader Remembrance of Dragonlord Placidusax, hewn into the Erdtree. The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader. Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes. The Dragonlord whose seat lies at the heart of the storm beyond time is said to have been Elden Lord in the age before the Erdtree. Once his god was fled, the lord continued to await its return.
00000B8FRemembrance of the Full Moon QueenTake the power of its namesake via Finger Reader Remembrance of Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon, hewn into the Erdtree. The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader. Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes. In her youth, Rennala was a prominent champion who charmed the academy with her lunar magic, becoming its master. She also led the Glintstone Knights and established the house of Caria as royalty.
00000B90Remembrance of the LichdragonTake the power of its namesake via Finger Reader Remembrance of Lichdragon Fortissax, hewn into the Erdtree. The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader. Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes. After Godwyn the Golden became the Prince of Death, the ancient dragon fought long and hard against the Death within its companion. Alas, victory was never achieved and its only reward was corruption.
00000B91Remembrance of the Fire GiantTake the power of its namesake via Finger Reader Remembrance of Fire Giant, hewn into the Erdtree. The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader. Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes. The Fire Giant is a survivor of the War against the Giants. Upon realizing the flames of their forge would never die, Queen Marika marked him with a curse. "O trifling giant, mayest thou tend thy flame for eternity."
00000B92Remembrance of the Regal AncestorTake the power of its namesake via Finger Reader Remembrance of the Regal Ancestor Spirit, hewn into the Erdtree. The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader. Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes. Ancestral spirits exist as a phenomenon beyond the purview of the Erdtree. Life sprouts from death, as it does from birth. Such is the way of the living.
00000B93Elden RemembranceTake the power of its namesake via Finger Reader Remembrance of the Elden Beast, hewn into the Erdtree. The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader. Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes. It was the vassal beast of the Greater Will and living incarnation of the concept of Order.
00000B94Remembrance of the NaturalbornTake the power of its namesake via Finger Reader Remembrance of Astel, Naturalborn of the Void, hewn into the Erdtree. The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader. Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes. A malformed star born in the lightless void far away. Once destroyed an Eternal City and took away their sky. A falling star of ill omen.
00000BAELands Between RuneUse to gain many runes Grace said to have once dwelled in the eyes of the inhabitants of the Lands Between; the lingering residue of gold. Use to gain 3000 runes. No grace resides in the eyes of the Tarnished; if it ever did, it is now lost.
00000BB8Ancestral Infant's HeadUses FP to spray spirit vapor Skull of a very young ancestral spirit. Just think how many sproutings It might bear. Uses FP to spray spirit vapor, inflicting magic damage. The vapor becomes a temporary geyser which deals continuous damage to everything it touches until it disappears.
00000BC2Omen BairnUses FP to unleash wraiths that chase down foes Doll of a curseborn bairn. Uses FP to unleash wraiths that chase down foes. Omen babies have all their horns excised, causing most to perish. These fetishes are made to memorialize them. "Please, don't hate me, or curse me. Please."
00000BC3Regal Omen BairnUses FP to unleash many wraiths that chase down foes Doll of a curseborn bairn from the Erdtree's royal line. Uses FP to unleash many wraiths that chase down foes. Omen babies born of royalty do not have their horns excised, but instead are kept underground, unbeknownst to anyone, imprisoned for eternity. These memorial fetishes are fashioned in secret.
00000BCCMiranda's PrayerUses FP to call down a deluge of light This statuette depicts a flower that preys on humans, posed in prayer. Uses FP to call down a deluge of light. Miranda, maiden of the Flower Crucible is said to have been the very first of this breed.
00000BD6Cuckoo GlintstoneThrow to produce magic bolts on impact Lump of broken glintstone enwreathed with magic power. A "faux sorcery" used by the Knights of the Cuckoo. Launched straight ahead. Magic bolts spring forth from the point of impact.
00000BE0Mimic's VeilUses FP to mimic nearby objects Golden veil of intricate design. Uses FP to mimic nearby objects. When Godrick was hounded from Leyndell, the Royal Capital, this was one of a multitude of treasures he took with him. Also known as "Marika's Mischief."
00000BEAGlintstone ScrapCrush gem to produce magic bolts Piece of glintstone tinged with unstable magic. Found in crystal tunnels. Crush gem to produce magic bolts. Poor quality and thereby easily broken, a sorcerer wouldn't give it a second look.
00000BEBLarge Glintstone ScrapCrush gem to produce many magic bolts Large piece of glintstone tinged with unstable magic. Found in crystal tunnels. Crush gem to produce magic bolts. Poor quality and thereby easily broken, a sorcerer wouldn't give it a second look.
00000BF4Gravity Stone FanThrow near foes to make fan-shaped gravitational shockwave Shard of rock found in the wake of a meteorite strike. It is imbued with a particularly weighty magic. Throw near foes to make fan-shaped gravitational shockwave. The desperate ones who scavenge for these shards dub themselves "starcallers."
00000BFEGravity Stone ChunkThrow at foe to cause a gravitational explosion Shard of rock found in the wake of a meteorite strike. It is imbued with a particularly weighty magic. Throw at enemies to cause a gravitational explosion. The desperate ones who scavenge for these shards dub themselves "starcallers."
00000C08Wraith Calling BellUses FP to ring bell and calls prowling wraiths Bell used by worshippers of revenants. Ring bell, using FP to summon prowling wraiths. This can be done multiple times in a row. Wraiths are said to be the vengeful spirits of those who died when cursed.
00000CE4Holy Water GreaseConsumes FP, allowing weapon to purify undead foes Grease which holds the blessing of the Erdtree. Craftable item. Consumes FP when coated on weapon, allowing it to deal magical damage and purify those who have lived beyond death. There is no place in the Golden Order for those who have exceeded life's bounds. These blemishes must be hunted down by the Virtuous.
00000CEEWarming StoneContinuously heal nearby allies Ruin Fragment blessed with an incantation of the Two Fingers. Generates warmth where activated, continuously restoring the HP of nearby allies. It's said that the Erdtree was once as warm as the gentle sun, and would gradually heal all who bathed in its rays.
00000CEFFrenzyflame StoneUses FP to continuously heal chaos followers Ruin Fragment blessed with an incantation of the Three Fingers. Craftable item. Uses FP to generate warmth, continuously restoring the HP of those who host the frenzied flame. Confers madness upon those who have not adopted the flame. Take care not to mistake this for its gentler cousin.
00000CF8ScriptstoneReveals more messages from other worlds Ruin Fragment with a cipher inscription. Craftable item. Uses FP to reveal more messages from other worlds. Words are gregarious things, drawn to one another much as people are.
00000D16Bewitching BranchMist briefly makes allies of foes Tree branch blessed with an incantation of unalloyed gold. Thrust branch forward to release a beguiling mist, entrancing foes such that they temporarily join your cause. The Empyrean Miquella is loved by many people. Indeed, he has learned very well how to compel such affection.
00000D20Baldachin's BlessingUses FP to temporarily boost poise Favor bestowed by a deathbed companion. Protection of a hidden temple in the guise of a bedchamber. Uses FP to temporarily boost poise. The favor allows one to forget any aches and pains. In Death, there is only peace, for in Death, there can be no sensation.
00000D21Radiant Baldachin's BlessingUses FP to temporarily boost poise Protection of a hidden temple in the guise of a bedchamber. This blessing is of the utmost rarity. Uses FP to temporarily raise poise. The effect lasts longer than a mere favor. It is said a deathbed companion will only produce a blessing of this kind for a champion but once in her entire life. The sole blessing which she imbues of her own volition.
00000DACUplifting AromaticBoosts attack power and reduces incoming damage once Art of the perfumers who fought in the Shattering. Raises the attack power of the user and nearby allies while also reducing the damage from one incoming attack by half. This aromatic has an extremely potent morale-raising effect that makes those accustomed to it fearless in the face of death. It was this influence that made the perfumers exceptional commanders.
00000DB6Spark AromaticBroadly scatter sparks in a wide area Art of the perfumers who fought in the Shattering. Broadly scatters sparks in a wide arc straight ahead. Though fire was prohibited to those who served the Erdtree, this rule was forgotten as the war drew ever on.
00000DC0Ironjar AromaticRaises defenses but lowers mobility Forbidden art of depraved perfumers. Temporarily turns body to steel, boosting poise, resistances and damage negation at the expense of mobility and lightning resistance. An art that requires fragments of hunted noble jars. Depraved perfumers are plainly in league with jar poachers.
00000DDEBloodboil AromaticRaises attack but also damage received Forbidden art of depraved perfumers. Induces a temporary state of fervor, raising maximum attack power and stamina while also increasing damage received. "Even upon the battlefield, do you fear being wounded? Take a good look. Your limbs are frozen stiff."
00000DFCPoison SpraymistReleases a poison mist that travels forwards Forbidden art of depraved perfumers. Releases a poison mist from user's mouth that travels forwards, causing a buildup of poison. Perfumed powder is held in the mouth to dissolve before being expelled. It was once a restorative art, or so it is said.
00000E1AAcid SpraymistReleases acidic mist and lowers attack Forbidden art of depraved perfumers. Releases an acidic mist from user's mouth that travels forwards, damaging armaments and temporarily lowering attack power. Perfumed powder is held in the mouth to dissolve before being expelled. It was once a restorative art, or so it is said.
00001F40Stonesword KeyUse to break one imp statue seal but lost upon use A sword-shaped stone key. Breaks the seal on imp statues, but remains embedded in the statue after use, meaning it can only be used once as an item. Think well before using one.
00001F45Cord EndGain entry somewhere A carefully woven cord. This cord belonged to the young girls who were housed in a place that was meant as an eternal secret. The cutting-gifted tribe vowed to sacrifice their flesh while concealing the truth. But the girls were too young to oblige.
00001FA6Lucent Baldachin's BlessingRaise in prayer to gain protection Sacred seal of a hidden shrine that looks much like a bedchamber. A faint light leaks through a crack in its fastened doors, as if the Firefly is beckoning to come inside. Raise in prayer to gain protection. Gaining protection consumes this item, but can grant unique effects. Take care though, these effects cannot be undone.
00001FA9Dectus Medallion (Left)Join medallions to operate Grand Lift of Dectus Left half of a split medallion depicting the Erdtree. Brandishing the medallion with both halves conjoined will activate the Grand Lift of Dectus, connecting the Altus Plateau to Liurnia. The right half is said to reside in Fort Faroth in the Dragonbarrow, far to the east.
00001FAADectus Medallion (Right)Join medallions to operate Grand Lift of Dectus Right half of a split medallion depicting the Erdtree. Brandishing the medallion with both halves conjoined will activate the Grand Lift of Dectus, connecting the Altus Plateau to Liurnia. The left half is said to reside in the coastal Fort Haight to the far west.
00001FABRold MedallionOperates Grand Lift of Rold Conjoined split medallion depicting the Flame Peak. Brandishing the medallion activates the Grand Lift of Rold, connecting Leyndell to the Mountaintops of the Giants. The forge of the flame of ruin is said to be found upon their peaks, and it is here Melina wishes to travel in resuming your journey together.
00001FADAcademy Glintstone KeyKey to open the academy's two sealed gates Key to the seals binding both gates to the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Activates warp magic bound within the seals. A glintstone key will remember its user, meaning once used it can never be passed on to another. The academy does not welcome the indolent.
00001FAFCarian Inverted StatueKey revealing the hidden form of Carian Study Hall Statuette of a scholar, with ground and sky inverted. Reveals the hidden form of the Carian Study Hall, which connects to the divine tower. To unveil the secret, affix it to the pedestal of the celestial globe.
00001FB9Dark Moon RingRing of Lunar Princess Ranni's cold oath Ring depicting a leaden full moon. Symbolic of a cold oath, the ring is supposed to be given by Lunar Princess Ranni to her consort. Ranni is an Empyrean, meaning her consort would by rights earn the title of lord. A warning is engraved within; "Whoever thou mayest be, take not the ring from this place, the solitude beyond the night is better mine alone."

If offered to the blind maiden, it will lead her to the source of the distant light, allowing her to become a Finger Maiden.

00001FCEAmber StarlightIngredient used in special draught An ephemeral sliver that gives off a pale amber glow. What remains of a passing flash of starlight. If the stars command our fates, then amber-hued stars must command the fates of the gods. Such is the belief that inspired the use of these shards to prepare a most special draught. Cannot be consumed by mere humans.

00001FD0Sellen's Primal GlintstoneGlintstone from within Sellen's body Glintstone from within the sorceress Sellen's body. Seemingly half-alive, blood vessels are visible within. In essence, a primal glintstone is a sorcerer's soul. If transplanted into a compatible new body after their original body dies, the sorcerer will rise again. "My apprentice, do you think it distasteful?"

00001FDALord of Blood's FavorPure white oath-cloth given by VarrÃ© Pure white oath-cloth given by VarrÃ©. The final trial to be anointed a Knight of Mohg, Lord of Blood. "Soak the cloth with a maiden's blood... The blood of anyone's maiden will do. You are maidenless, after all."
00001FDBLord of Blood's FavorBloodied white oath-cloth, dyed in a maiden's blood Fully reddened oath-cloth, dyed in a maiden's blood. The final trial is complete. Luminary Mohg is sure to welcome you into his service, as a knight who will lay the foundations for his dynasty.
00001FDCBurial Crow's LetterLetter affixed to a graveyard crow's leg A letter affixed to a graveyard crow's leg. Sought after by KalÃ©.
00001FDESpirit Calling BellBell that summons various spirits from ashen items A bell capable of summoning various spirits from ashen remains. It usually requires FP to use. Spirits can only be summoned in the vicinity of a rebirth monument. When summoning is possible, the monument icon will be visible on the left side of the screen. Only one type of spirit may be summoned at once, and none may be summoned during multiplayer.
00001FDFFingerslayer BladeHidden treasure of the Eternal City of Nokron The hidden treasure of the Eternal City of Nokron; a blade said to have been born of a corpse. This blood-drenched fetish is proof of the high treason committed by the Eternal City and symbolizes its downfall. Cannot be wielded by those without a fate, but is said to be able to harm the Greater Will and its vassals.
00001FE1Sewing NeedleBoc the demi-human's prized sewing needle A large sewing needle, curved like a fang. Boc the demi-human's prized possession.
00001FE2Gold Sewing NeedleSpecial sewing needle for demigod attire Sewing needle made of gold. Unique item made to alter demigod attire. One of the tools brought by Radagon when he entered into marriage with Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon, and joined the Carian line.
00001FE3Tailoring ToolsEnables armor adjustment at sites of grace A portable set of tailoring tools. Enables armor alterations at sites of grace.
00001FE4Seluvis's PotionSmall flask received from Preceptor Seluvis Small flask received from Preceptor Seluvis containing a cloudy tonic of bluish black. "Find Nepheli, and ensure she drinks it."
00001FE6Amber DraughtGlistening amber draught made for a scheme Small flask received from Preceptor Seluvis containing a gleaming amber draught for use in a scheme. "Give it to Ranni and ensure she drinks it. And we'll be in a position to claim the very finest puppet ever crafted."
00001FE7Letter to PatchesRequest from Volcano Manor to Patches Examine using A written request from Volcano Manor addressed to Patches disclosing the name of a Tarnished to be hunted. "Great Horned Tragoth" He can be found at the Ruin-Strewn Precipice. Find the red mark on your map for the exact location.
00001FE8Dancer's CastanetsCastanets used by dancers from distant lands Castanets used by dancers from foreign lands. Received from Patches. The passionate dance comprises no seductiveness, but merely a dignified beauty.
00001FE9Sellian SealbreakerCan release Master Lusat from his confinement Glintstone key received from the sorceress Sellen. Capable of breaking the seal that keeps Master Lusat confined. Sellia, Town of Sorcery can be found in Caelid. This key was said to have been found in the possession of a Sellian sorcerer.
00001FEBChrysalids' MementoBroach wrapped in red velvet Memento left by the chrysalids sacrificed for grafting. A brooch wrapped in red velvet. Traces of blood are visible. Faintly visible spirits try to convey something, but their voices cannot be heard.
00001FECBlack KnifeprintMark of the Night of the Black Knives ritual On the Night of the Black Knives, someone stole a fragment of Death from Maliketh, the Black Blade, and imbued its power into the assassins' daggers. This mark is evidence of the ritual, and hides the truth of the conspiracy.
00001FEDLetter to BernahlRequest from Volcano Manor to Bernahl Examine using A written request from Volcano Manor addressed to Bernahl disclosing the names of two Tarnished to be hunted. "Vargram the Raging Wolf" "Errant Sorcerer Wilhelm" Both men can be found in the Royal Capital of Leyndell. Find the red mark on your map for the exact location.
00001FEEAcademy Glintstone KeyKey to open the academy's two sealed gates Key to the seals binding both gates to the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Activates warp magic bound within the seals. This glintstone key is still brand new, unused by anyone.
00001FEFHaligtree Secret Medallion (Left)Join medallions to operate Grand Lift of Rold Left half of a split medallion depicting the Haligtree. Brandishing the medallion with both halves conjoined will activate the Grand Lift of Rold, granting access to a hidden path. In other words, this secret medallion will guide the bearer to the land of Miquella's Haligtree.
00001FF0Haligtree Secret Medallion (Right)Join medallions to operate Grand Lift of Rold Right half of a split medallion depicting the Haligtree. Brandishing the medallion with both halves conjoined will activate the Grand Lift of Rold, granting access to a hidden path. In other words, this secret medallion will guide the bearer to the land of Miquella's Haligtree.
00001FF5Burial Crow's LetterLetter written about the caravans A letter written about the caravans. It seems to have been sent from the capital underground.
00001FF6Mending Rune of Perfect OrderCan be used to mend the shattered Elden Ring Rune discovered by the noble Goldmask. Used to restore the fractured Elden Ring when brandished by the Elden Lord. A rune of transcendental ideology which will attempt to perfect the Golden Order. The current imperfection of the Golden Order, or instability of ideology, can be blamed upon the fickleness of the gods no better than men. That is the fly in the ointment.
00001FF7Mending Rune of the Death-PrinceCan be used to mend the shattered Elden Ring Rune gestated by Fia, the Deathbed Companion. Used to restore the fractured Elden Ring when brandished by the Elden Lord. Formed of the two hallowbrand half-wheels combined, it will embed the principle of life within Death into Order. The Golden Order was created by confining Destined Death. Thus, this new Order will be one of Death restored.
00001FF8Mending Rune of the Fell CurseCan be used to mend the shattered Elden Ring Loathsome rune gestated by the Dung Eater. Used to restore the fractured Elden Ring when brandished by the Elden Lord. The reviled curse will last eternally, and the world's children, grandchildren, and every generation hence, will be its pustules. If Order is defiled entirely, defilement is defilement no more, and for every curse, a cursed blessing.
00001FF9Larval TearMaterial needed by Rennala to grant rebirth Core of a creature of mimicry known as a silver tear. As much a substance as it is a living organism. Material required by the amber egg cradled by Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon, to birth people anew. Being born anew allows the reallocation of attributes boosted by leveling up.
00001FFAImbued Sword KeyUnseals sending gate, but disappears upon use Stone key shaped like a sword. A special item, imbued with rich blue magic. Breaks the seal on the imp statues guarding the sending gates enshrined in each belfry, but remains embedded in the statue after use, meaning it can only be used once as an item. Think well before using one.
00001FFBMiniature RanniDoll resembling Ranni the Witch A doll resembling Ranni the Witch. From head to toe every detail is perfect. The chilliness is gone, feeling now like an empty husk. There is no response.
00001FFCGolden Tailoring ToolsAllows demigod garb alteration at sites of grace Tailoring tools made from gold. Tools brought with the red-haired Radagon when he married into the Carian line. With these, even demigod attire can be altered at a site of grace.
00001FFDIji's ConfessionLetter of confession found on Iji's corpse A letter of confession found on Iji's corpse. He declares his own guilt for having sealed away Blaidd.
00001FFEKnifeprint ClueSimple map showing location of black knifeprint Examine using A simple map given by Fia. A clue to the whereabouts of a black knifeprint.
00001FFFCursemark of DeathCursemark carved into Lunar Princess Ranni's discarded flesh Cursemark carved into the discarded flesh of Ranni the Witch. Also known as the half-wheel wound of the centipede. This cursemark was carved at the moment of Death of the first demigod, and should have taken the shape of a circle. However, two demigods perished at the same time, breaking the cursemark into two half-wheels. Ranni was the first of the demigods whose flesh perished, while the Prince of Death perished in soul alone.
00002000Asimi's HuskThe shedding of an Asimi that infected a tarnished The shedding of an Asimi that infected a tarnished.
00002001Seedbed CurseCurse grown on a body defiled by the Dung Eater Curse grown on a corpse killed and defiled by the Dung Eater. A tender pox afflicted with omen horns. The Dung Eater cultivates the seedbed curse on corpses. By doing so he prevents dead souls returning to the Erdtree, leaving them forever cursed. One of the most loathsome things found in all the Lands Between.
00002002The Stormhawk KingAshes of a hawk which heeds no summons Ashes of a hawk revered by all others as sovereign back in the days when Stormveil's winds still raged like no other. This ancient monarch is proud however, refusing to answer anyone's summons.

Bears no trace of befouled blood, but is faintly moist with dew. "There is something I must return to Malenia. The dignity, the sense of self, that allowed her to resist the call of the scarlet rot."

0000218EWhetstone KnifeCan add new battle arts and affinities to weapons Whetstone with a cipher inscription, made to look like a small knifeblade. Allows the use of ashes of war at a site of grace to bestow new battle arts and affinities to armaments as skills. The battle arts and affinities will depend on the ashes of war used.
00002198Map: Limgrave, WestMap of Limgrave's western region Map of the western region of Limgrave. The demesne of Limgrave, far south of the Erdtree, is bordered to the northwest by the cliffs of Stormveil, and under its ever-clouded skies roll the great steppes of the pale lands.
00002199Map: Weeping PeninsulaMap of Weeping peninsula Map of the Weeping Peninsula. The peninsula, to Limgrave's south, is named for its unceasing rainfall, redolent of lament.
0000219AMap: Limgrave, EastMap of Limgrave's eastern region Map of the eastern region of Limgrave. Other than the Mistwood which envelops the south, it is known for its lands which lead to Caelid, a path trod by many a soldier in the past.
0000219BMap: Liurnia, EastMap of Liurnia's eastern region Map of Liurnia's eastern region. The majority of Liurnia, known for its vast forests and ever-present fog, is sinking into a lake. The eastern coast is home to a highroad running north and south.
0000219CMap: Liurnia, NorthMap of Liurnia's northern region Map of Liurnia's northern region. The Academy of Raya Lucaria towers over the north, while at its base spreads the town built around it, now flooded. Two highroads end their journeys here.
0000219DMap: Liurnia, WestMap of Liurnia's western region Map of Liurnia's western region. The majority of Liurnia, known for its vast forests and ever-present fog, is sinking into a lake. The western coast has always been closely associated with Carian royalty.
0000219EMap: Altus PlateauMap of Altus Plateau and environs Map of Altus Plateau and environs. The Altus Plateau, where the Erdtree's base can be found, contains the Royal Capital of Leyndell to the east, and Mt. Gelmir to the west. Scars from the Shattering remain apparent to this day.
0000219FMap: Leyndell, Royal CapitalMap of Leyndell Capital and environs Map of the Royal Capital of Leyndell and environs. Leyndell, City of the Erdtree, is a metropolis enclosed by double ramparts. The inner wall remains unbreached to this day.
000021A0Map: Mt. GelmirMap of Mt. Gelmir and environs Map of Mt. Gelmir and environs. Mt. Gelmir, which houses the Volcano Manor at its summit, is characterized by sheer cliffs and ominous skies. These qualities only became more pronounced after the Shattering.
000021A1Map: CaelidMap of Caelid and environs Map of Caelid and environs. Caelid, known as the locale of the last battle between General Radahn and Malenia, Blade of Miquella, is a vast land consummately marred by scarlet rot.
000021A2Map: DragonbarrowMap of Dragonbarrow and environs Map of Dragonbarrow and environs. The dragons that escaped the scarlet rot made a nest of the plateau to Caelid's north. Thus it was named "Dragonbarrow," and none dare to enter.
000021A3Map: Mountaintops of the Giants, WestMap of Western Mountaintops of the Giants Map of Western Mountaintops of the Giants. Marching ground during the War against the Giants. They carved winding paths in the cliff walls right up to the summit, leading to the untrodden snow-laden region beyond.
000021A4Map: Mountaintops of the Giants, EastMap of Eastern Mountaintops of the Giants Map of Eastern Mountaintops of the Giants. The remote, desolate eastern summit is the highest point in all the Lands Between, overlooking even the Flame Peak to the south.
000021A5Map: Ainsel RiverMap of Ainsel River and environs Map of Ainsel River and environs. Two great rivers flow beneath the Lands Between, the Siofra and the Ainsel. This vast region is said to be the grave of civilizations that flourished before the Erdtree.
000021A6Map: Lake of RotMap of Lake of Rot and environs Map of Lake of Rot and environs. A great lake of standing water downstream of the Ainsel River. It is said that the divine essence of an outer god is sealed away in this land.
000021A7Map: Siofra RiverMap of Siofra River and environs Map of Siofra River and environs. Two great rivers flow beneath the Lands Between, the Siofra and the Ainsel. This vast region is said to be the grave of civilizations that flourished before the Erdtree.
000021A8Map: Mohgwyn PalaceMap of Mohgwyn Palace and environs Map of Mohgwyn Palace and environs. In the lightless depths lies the grave of an ancient civilization. It is here Mohg, the Lord of Blood, is building his palace, to be the seat of his coming dynasty named Mohgwyn. And whatever nightmares that may bring.
000021A9Map: Deeproot DepthsMap of Deeproot Depths and environs Map of Deeproot Depths and environs. At the very depths of the Erdtree's majestic roots lies the source of the Ainsel and the Siofra rivers. Here too begins the network of Greattree roots that spread throughout the Lands Between.
000021AAMap: Consecrated SnowfieldMap of Consecrated Snowfield and environs Map of Consecrated Snowfield and environs. The route through this land, crossed east to west by a frozen river, leads to Miquella's Haligtree. This is the path taken by those unchosen, though it is a trial all the same.

Can be given to a learned cleric to gain access to the following incantations: - Lightning Spear - Honed Bolt - Electrify Armament
000022A1Ancient Dragon PrayerbookGive to a learned cleric to acquire new incantations Prayerbook of the capital's ancient dragon cult. A lost tome that never reached the Lands Between. Contains red lightning incantations. Can be given to a learned cleric to gain access to the following incantations: - Ancient Dragons' Lightning Spear - Ancient Dragons' Lightning Strike
000022A2Academy ScrollGive to a learned sorcerer to acquire new sorceries Scroll of the Academy of Raya Lucaria, the glintstone sorcerers' place of study. Can be given to a learned sorcerer to gain access to the following sorceries: - Great Glintstone Shard - Swift Glintstone Shard
000022CEPidia's Bell BearingOffer to Twin Maiden Husks for new item access Servant Pidia's bell bearing, found upon his perished flesh. Offer to the Twin Maiden Husks at the Roundtable Hold to gain access to new items.
000022CFSeluvis's Bell BearingOffer to Twin Maiden Husks for new item access Preceptor Seluvis's bell bearing, found upon his perished flesh. Offer to the Twin Maiden Husks at the Roundtable Hold to gain access to new items.

Offer to the Twin Maiden Husks at the Roundtable Hold to gain access to the following items: - Sliver of Meat - Lump of Flesh - Turtle Neck Meat

0000230AIron WhetbladeGrants choice of affinity upgrade to weapon Iron whetblade with a cipher engraved. Can be used as a whetstone knife. When applying an affinity using ashes of war, an additional affinity of heavy, keen, or quality can be chosen.
0000230BRed-Hot WhetbladeGrants choice of affinity upgrade to weapon Red-hot whetblade with a cipher engraved. Can be used as a whetstone knife. When applying an affinity using physical or flame-type ashes of war, an additional affinity of fire or flame art can be chosen.
0000230CSanctified WhetbladeGrants choice of affinity upgrade to weapon Sanctified whetblade with a cipher engraved. Can be used as a whetstone knife. When applying an affinity using physical or golden-type ashes of war, an additional affinity of sacred or lightning can be chosen.
0000230DGlintstone WhetbladeGrants choice of affinity upgrade to weapon Glintstone whetblade with a cipher engraved. Can be used as a whetstone knife. When applying an affinity using physical or magic-type ashes of war, an additional affinity of magic or frost can be chosen.
0000230EBlack WhetbladeGrants choice of affinity upgrade to weapon Black whetblade with a cipher engraved. Can be used as a whetstone knife. When applying an affinity using physical or occult-type ashes of war, an additional affinity of poison, blood, or occult can be chosen.
0000230FUnalloyed Gold NeedleSnapped intricate needle of unalloyed gold An intricately crafted needle of unalloyed gold, snapped in half. A ritual implement crafted to ward away the meddling of outer gods, it is thought capable of forestalling the incurable rotting sickness. Sage Gowry has designs for this needle.
00002310Unalloyed Gold NeedleRepaired intricate needle of unalloyed gold An intricately crafted needle of unalloyed gold. Once snapped in half, it has been repaired by Sage Gowry. A ritual implement crafted to ward away the meddling of outer gods, it is thought capable of forestalling the incurable rotting sickness. "Now, all you need do is deliver the needle to Millicent, convalescing in the church atop the cliff just beyond Sellia."
00002311Valkyrie's ProsthesisGolden prosthesis used by the one-armed Valkyrie Golden prosthesis once used by the one-armed valkyrie. A masterwork of craftsmanship, with practice and skill it can be used as proficiently as a real arm. When Maleigh Marais, Lord of the Shaded Castle, embraced this prosthesis, he claimed to feel the presence of his personal goddess.
00002312Sellia's SecretA piece of paper given by Sage Gowry Examine using Note given by Sage Gowry detailing the secret he promised. The Town of Sellia hides the source. Light three flames atop the candle towers to break the seal.
00002313Beast EyeSaid to tremble when close to Deathroot Claw-marked stone eye received from Gurranq, Beast Clergyman. It is said to tremble when near Deathroot. The murky violet iris writhes as if alive. "I am not sated... Feed me more...Death..."
00002314Weathered DaggerDagger received from Fia, Deathbed Companion Dagger received from Fia, the Deathbed Companion. She wishes for it to be returned to its rightful owner. It was once a special weapon of gold and silver intertwined, but is now worn down and marred by a black gash.

0000235AThe Ring
